speaker: Dad
text: How did this work again? Which one do I press...

speaker: Son
text: Dad! Hello? Can you hear me?

speaker: Dad
text: Johnny, my boy! Can you hear me alright?

speaker: Son
text: Yeah, dad. I can hear you. Can you hear me?

speaker: Dad
text: Yes! Yes, it's good to hear you again, Johnny. How are you doing?

speaker: Son
text: Good, dad. I'm doing good.

speaker: Dad
text:
Look! I got springrolls! I made 'em this morning, so they're damn ugly. The
cooking ladies on the internet make everything look so easy.

speaker: Son
text: It looks really good, dad. You're getting a lot better at it.

speaker: Dad
text:
I'm gonna get you to try it once you can get home. I'll keep practicing. Maybe
one of these days, they'll taste like your mom's.

speaker: Son
text: Yeah, that'd be great.

speaker: Dad
text: What have you got, Johnny?

choices: As you can see, I just got the usual frozen microwave dinner.
You know, I just got the usual frozen microwave dinner.

speaker: Dad
text: That actually doesn't look half bad! You must be pretty busy, eh, Johnny?

speaker: Son
text: Yeah, work really tires me out.

speaker: Dad
text:
Oh, Johnny. I keep tellin' you that those things aren't good for you. Full of
plastic and chemicals. You gotta watch your health, or you'll regret it when you
get to my age.

speaker: Son
text: I know, dad. Work just really tires me out.

speaker: Dad
text: Well, I'm starving. Let's eat.

speaker: Dad
text: Munch munch munch...

speaker: Son
text: Munch munch munch...

speaker: Son
text: So, what else did you do today? Munch munch munch...

speaker: Dad
text:
Munch munch munch... Not a lot. I took a nap and watched some TV. There's never
anything interesting on anymore. Not things I like, anyway.

speaker: Son
text:
That sounds nice. I think I'll have to do overtime again this weekend. Not
looking forward to that. Munch munch munch...

speaker: Dad
text:
They're working you half to death! Munch munch munch... You gotta find a place
that treats you better, Johnny. I'm telling you, I never worked overtime like you
do when I was your age.

speaker: Son
text: I know, dad. I'm looking. Munch munch munch...

speaker: Dad
text: Cheers! Glug glug glug...

speaker: Son
text: Cheers! glug glug glug...

speaker: Dad
text:
It was good seeing you again, Johnny. Make sure you get home whenever you can.
Come home soon.

speaker: Son
text: I know, dad. It'll take some time, but I'm trying.

speaker: Dad
text: I know.

speaker: Son
text: Goodnight, dad. I'll see again, same time next week.

speaker: Dad
text: Goodnight.

speaker: Son
text: (Stands and walks away, tossing his plastic container into the trash.)

speaker: Dad
text:
(Looks out the window, then back at the black screen. Stands and shuffles to the
sink to clean the dishes. He drops a towel and reluctantly picks it up, tired,
then continues on his way.)
